data.title: Publications
data.text:
Opinions Maher Saadat Opinions Maher Saadat

نگاهی به بخش اول کتاب احمد مسعود

این مقاله نوشته ماهر سعادت به تحلیل بخش اول کتاب «به نام پدرم» نوشته احمد مسعود می‌پردازد. در این بخش، احمد مسعود به طور جامع به مبارزات مردم افغانستان در برابر طالبان و تلاش‌های خود برای حفظ آزادی و دموکراسی می‌پردازد.

Read More

News Kumayl Nazary News Kumayl Nazary

Ahmad Massoud's Participation in the Fourth Round of the Vienna Process

In a pivotal address at the fourth round of the Vienna Process, Ahmad Massoud, leader of the National Resistance Front of Afghanistan (NRF), underscored the necessity of unity among Afghan factions to overcome the nation's crisis. He critiqued the exclusion of women and civil society from the upcoming Doha conference and called for democratic elections to challenge the Taliban's rule. Massoud’s impassioned speech emphasized a future shaped by the will of the people, urging a united effort to rescue Afghanistan from its current turmoil.

Read More

Kumayl Nazary Kumayl Nazary

Afghanistan’s Struggle: The Path to Freedom with the National Resistance Front

The withdrawal of international support in August 2021 left Afghanistan under Taliban rule, resulting in widespread starvation, disease, and repression. As the international community debates the past and present, Afghanistan’s people continue to suffer. Discover the stark reality of life under the Taliban and the hope offered by the National Resistance Front.

Read More

The Lasting Legacy of Haidari Wujodi: Poet, Librarian, and Sufi Mystic

For over fifty years, Haidari Wujodi's desk at the Kabul Public Library stood as a beacon of wisdom and serenity amidst Afghanistan's tumultuous landscape. In a country beset by conflict, his presence offered a haven of enlightenment for poets, musicians, students, and all who sought solace. Deeply cherished by the people yet largely unacknowledged by the government, Wujodi's legacy endures through his evocative poetry, mentorship, and bi-weekly Rumi reading sessions. These gatherings fostered a vibrant community of spiritual seekers, reflecting his profound influence on contemporary poetry and Persian culture. Wujodi's life and work continue to bridge Afghanistan's rich literary heritage with its modern challenges.

Read More

Kumayl Nazary Kumayl Nazary

A Daughter’s Tribute

Commander Muslem Hayat, a legendary hero and true patriot of Afghanistan, leaves behind a legacy of courage, compassion, and an unwavering commitment to his country. His daughter Maria Hayat shares heartfelt memories and the enduring impact of her father's life — from the battlefield to the lessons he imparted about the importance of serving and loving their homeland. This tribute reveals the profound influence of a father not only celebrated as a leader but also cherished as a mentor, friend, and family man.

Read More

Anti-Taliban Resistance Unites

Discover the collective call for freedom in Afghanistan as political currents unite against the Taliban's rule, advocating for peace, democracy, and human rights. Read more about their vision for a future that honors the will of the people.

Read More

Opinions Kumayl Nazary Opinions Kumayl Nazary

Unfinished Business in Afghanistan

Nearly two years after the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, the call to honor the promises to Afghan allies has never been more urgent. This op-ed explores the imperative to support Afghan allies through asylum and beyond, advocating for a comprehensive approach to uphold the promises made.

Read More

Exploring Ahmad Massoud's Journey in Resisting Afghanistan’s Political Crisis

Explore the insightful journey of Ahmad Massoud and the National Resistance Front of Afghanistan in our latest article. Discover how they confront tyranny and champion the cause of freedom, justice, and democracy in Afghanistan, amidst the struggles against the Taliban's oppressive regime. Read on to understand the NRF's vision for a pluralistic, decentralized political future and its global implications. Dive into this compelling narrative of resistance and hope in Afghanistan.

Read More

Fulfilling an Ethnocentric Agenda

In a recent alarming move, the Taliban's illegal regime deployed an overwhelming force of 13,000 morality police, exacerbating the dire situation for women and girls in Afghanistan. These morality officers patrol Kabul, enforcing regressive moral codes and detaining dozens for non-compliance. This crackdown not only violates basic human rights but instills a climate of fear and gender apartheid. Disturbing reports of abductions, assaults, and exploitation in Taliban prisons underline the urgency of this crisis. Despite Taliban claims of moderation, these actions speak louder, revealing a regime deeply entrenched in misogyny and ethnocentrism.

Read More

News, Opinions Kumayl Nazary News, Opinions Kumayl Nazary

A Humanitarian Crisis Unfolding

In a startling move, Pakistan has begun expelling Afghan refugees, asylum seekers, and long-term residents, igniting a humanitarian crisis. This article delves into the harsh realities faced by these individuals, the violation of human rights, and the international outcry against Pakistan's actions. It highlights the struggles of families torn from their lives in Pakistan, now facing an uncertain future.

Read More

Taliban Implicated in Pul-Khumri Mosque Attack: National Resistance Front Speaks Out

In a stern statement, the National Resistance Front of Afghanistan has labeled the Taliban as primary culprits behind the recent devastating attack on Shiite worshippers in the Imam Zaman Mosque, Pul-Khumri. This condemnation comes amidst rising concerns over the Taliban's association with regional and international terrorist factions.

Read More

News, Breaking Kumayl Nazary News, Breaking Kumayl Nazary

Anti-Taliban Resistance Leader Addresses the European Union

In a significant event at the European Union Parliament, Ahmad Massoud, leader of the National Resistance Front of Afghanistan, conveys a clear message to the world: Engage with the people of Afghanistan, not the Taliban. He echoes the sentiments of his father from 22 years prior, warning the world of the growing dangers of extremism.

Read More

NRF Leader Advocates for Afghanistan's Freedom in Historic France Visit

In a significant engagement on French soil, NRF leader Ahmad Massoud echoes the cries of Afghanistan under Taliban siege, rallying support from French politicians. His joint venture, 'Our Freedom', with writer Olivier Weber, unveils a vision of hope, capturing his resistance journey against religious extremism. As Massoud urges the world to recall Afghanistan's plight, he reignites the spirit of enduring resistance to confront the darkness engulfing his homeland.

Read More

The Ongoing Threat of Terrorism 22 Years After 9/11

Two decades since the tragic events of September 11, the terrorist threat has not just remained but evolved, with extremists now controlling a state. The National Resistance Front of Afghanistan, continuing the fight abandoned by the US, stands alone in battling this renewed threat. Now more than ever, a unified international effort is imperative to support Afghanistan in this global challenge against terrorism.

Read More

Tribute Kumayl Nazary Tribute Kumayl Nazary

From Darkness to Dawn

Delve into the remarkable journey of the National Resistance Front of Afghanistan, where they stand as a symbol of courage and unwavering integrity, confronting adversity with determination.

Read More

Opinions, Education Kumayl Nazary Opinions, Education Kumayl Nazary

The Imperative of Underground Schools

In a nation under siege, underground schools in Afghanistan are emerging as sanctuaries of learning and resistance against the Taliban's oppressive rule. From nurturing free thought to safeguarding cultural heritage, discover why these hidden havens of education are more crucial now than ever.

Read More

Defying Darkness: The Secret Schools of Afghanistan

As darkness sweeps across Afghanistan, one Australian-led initiative is lighting the path to education for countless girls. Read on to discover the inspirational journey of the secret schools.

Read More

Opinions Kumayl Nazary Opinions Kumayl Nazary

Chairman McCaul's Stand for Afghanistan, and the Path Towards Democracy and Justice

Chairman McCaul's stance on Afghanistan funding resonates with American principles but needs to go further. Supporting Afghanistan's democratic forces will protect the oppressed abroad while preserving what we stand for as a nation.

Read More
